## THE PROBLEM {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Why Eviction Prediction Matters**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **13,499** eviction filings over past 12 months 
- Leads to homelessness & health consequences
- Current response is **reactive** — too late

[**Who is Affected?**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Low-income renters
- Rent-burdened households (30%+ on rent)
- Predominantly Black neighborhoods
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**The Decision We Inform**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Where to deploy emergency rental assistance
- Which tracts need tenant outreach
- How to allocate limited city resources

<br>

[**Goal:** Shift from reactive to **proactive** intervention]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## THE SOLUTION {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**What We're Predicting**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Monthly eviction filing counts by census tract

[**How Prediction Helps**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Identify high-risk tracts **before** spikes occur
- Enable proactive deployment of resources
- Target outreach to **prevent** evictions
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Better Than Current Practice**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

| Current Approach | Our Model |
|:-----------------|:----------|
| Wait for filings → React | Predict risk → Intervene early |
| Resources spread thin | Targeted allocation |
| Help comes too late | Prevention-focused |

[**Goal:** Early intervention prevents displacement]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Data Sources & Integration {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Primary Data**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **Eviction Lab** (2020–2023): Filing counts
- **ACS Census**: Demographics, housing, income
- **BLS**: Unemployment, wages, CPI

[**Spatial Features**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Economic activity density (KDE)
- Distance to eviction hot spots
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Panel Structure**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **Unit**: Census tract × month
- **Observations**: ~45,000 tract-months
- **Validation**: 70/30 train-test split

[**Key Variables**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Demographics: % Black, % renter
- Economic: Median income, wages
- Housing: Rent, building age
- Temporal: Year FE, moratorium
:::
:::

## Model Approach {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Why Negative Binomial Regression?**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Count data (0, 1, 2, ... filings per tract)
- High overdispersion (variance >> mean)
- Population offset → predicting **rate**, not raw counts
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Model Progression**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

| Model | Description |
|:------|:------------|
| 1 | Demographics only (% Black, % renter) |
| 2 | + Economic indicators (rent, CPI, wages) |
| 3 | + Year FE, moratorium, income quantiles |
| **4** | + Temporal lags, seasonality, spatial CV |
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Model Performance {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Validation Results (70/30 Split)**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

| Model | Train RMSE | Test RMSE |
|:------|:-----------|:----------|
| 1 (Demographics) | 2.42 | 2.40 |
| 2 (+ Economics) | 2.41 | 2.39 |
| 3 (+ Year FE) | 2.34 | 2.32 |
| **4 (Full)** | **2.34** | **2.24** |
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Key Predictors (Model 4)**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **% Renter households** — strongest predictor
- **% Black population** — demographic risk factor
- **Unemployment rate** — economic stress
- **Moratorium indicators** — policy effects captured
- **Economic density (KDE)** — spatial economic activity
:::
:::

## Limitations & Bias {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Technical Limitations**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Only captures **formal filings**
- Misses informal displacement
- Census data has 1–2 year lag
- Heteroskedasticity present

[**Data Gaps**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- No informal eviction data
- Limited COVID-era filings
- Cannot capture threats/harassment
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Bias Concerns**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Model may **reinforce** existing patterns
- High-risk labels could stigmatize neighborhoods
- % Black as predictor reflects systemic racism

[**Who Could Be Harmed?**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Over-policed if misused by landlords
- Stigma → reduced investment
- Self-fulfilling prophecy risk
:::
:::
